page.title: 01Thankerton Village Clydeside
page.content: Lowland farm country middle Clydeside. Seven miles SE Lanark,four W of Biggar. Area has a pleasant spacious feeling with lower part of Tinto Hill rising in south, dominating landscape. Main features wide Clyde River Valley with major road and rail links and village of Thankerton. Extensively farmed by River with cattle and sheep grazing farther out.High point Quothan Law Volcanic Hill Trig 385. large sand and gravel quarry by river. Roads A73(t) Lanark to Abington running SE including Junction with A72 to Biggar. Minor Roads to Thankerton and important Clyde Bridge at boat farm. Famous Tinto summit footpath starts car park at Fallburn farm. Rail - main line Euston to Glasgow/Edinburgh runs NW. No Stations.
